document.docAuthor: Pereira-Colavite, Alessandre & De, Claudio J. B.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomy of Neomuscina Townsend (Diptera, Muscidae) from Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomy of Neomuscina Townsend (Diptera, Muscidae) from Brazil

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis : acrostichal 0: 1 ; dorsocentral 2 : 3 ; mid femur with three preapical setae; male: intra-alar 1 ; female: epiproct with five setulae, setae in a x-shaped arrangement ( 2 : 1 : 2 ).

Color : general body coloration yellowish brown; frons dark yellow, apex darkened; facialia and parafacialia white; gena brown; antenna and palpus yellow; scutum with four dark stripes of grey pruinosity; apex of median and hind femora brown; calypters and halter yellow; wing hyaline.
Male . Length. Body: 6.0– 6.2 mm ; wing: 6.2–6.5 mm .

Head : eyes separated from each other by 0.07–0.11 mm , at level of ocellar tubercle; 14–15 pairs of frontal setae; ocellar seta large and parallel; postocellar seta large and divergent; inner vertical seta small and convergent; outer vertical seta small and divergent.

Thorax : acrostichal 0: 1 ; dorsocentral 2 : 3 ; intra-alar 1 ; many dark setulae adjacent to the lateral sclerites; apex of fore tibia with setae on dorsal, posterodorsal and posteroventral surfaces; mid femur with a row of setae on posteroventral surface from base to middle, and a row of weak anterior and anteroventral setae from base to middle; mid femur with three preapical setae, on dorsal, posterodorsal and posterior surfaces; apex of mid tibia with setae on anterior, dorsal, posterodorsal, posterior, posteroventral, ventral and anteroventral surfaces; hind femur with a complete row of dorsal, posteroventral and anteroventral setae; hind femur with many distinct anterodorsal setae, not ordered in a row, extending from base to middle; hind tibia with one median anterodorsal setae and four median anteroventral setae; hind tibia with anterior, anterodorsal, dorsal, posterodorsal, ventral and anteroventral setae at the apex; wing with one dorsal and two ventral setae at apex of stem vein.
Abdomen : epandrium with basal projection in profile; cercus excavated apically.

Female (differing as follows): Length. Body: 6.0– 6.2 mm ; wing: 6.2–6.5 mm ; eyes separated from each other by 0.28–0.3 mm , at level of ocellar tubercle; 9–10 pairs of frontal convergent setae, except for top two pairs, which are parallel; ocellar and postocellar setae large and divergent; inner vertical seta large and convergent, and outer vertical seta large and divergent; intra-alars 2 ; sternite VIII with strong spike-like setae; epiproct with five setae, setae in a x-shaped arrangement ( 2 : 1 : 2 ).

Comments :
N. inflexa
is characterized by the color pattern and dorsocentrals 2 : 3 . Males have a square sternite V, r e s e m b l i n g
N. maculata
sp. nov.
and females have sternite VIII with strong spike-like setae and an epiproct with a 2 : 1 : 2 setae arrangement.

Holotype
(not examined): MSNM . Type-locality: São Paulo.

Material examined : BRAZIL . Paraná.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 35–40.
Neomuscina inflexa
. Male terminalia: 35. Fifth sternite, dorsal view; 36. Epandrium, surstylus and cercal plate, lateral view; 37. Epandrium, surstylus and cercal plate, posterior view; 38. Aedeagus, lateral view. Female terminalia: 39. Dorsal view; 40. Ventral view. (Scale 0.5 mm)

subSubSection.paragraph: Geographical distribution : Argentina , Brazil (Paraná, Rio de Janeiro, Santa Catarina [new-locality] and São Paulo [type-locality]).
